Entries.default: "How did you ever find me all the way out HERE? Did Aenalys send you?"
"Kahn sent me after you."
"Ahhh, yes. Aha. Yes, indeed." His attention is suddenly diverted by an apparently fascinating stain on the hem of his robe.
"Look, I really stuck my neck out here..."

"You did risk life and limb for me, it's true. And make no mistake, I AM grateful. Really, really grateful. Believe me, I would give you something if I could."

His eyes take on a faraway look, and he takes a deep breath.
"Don't make me grab you by the ankles and shake."

"Shake all you like! You'll find naught but some lint and a mouldering old handkerchief.

"Well, and this old ring. It's the last possession of any value I own.

"Here, take it. For your trouble."
[Leave] "Now that you're safe, I should be off."
"I owe you a debt too large to repay, stranger." He wrings his hands and gives you a shaky smile.
"Thank the gods, you're back! Have you changed your mind? May I join your crew? Please, don't leave me here!"
"Why did the Inquisitor have you on trial, exactly?"

"After what you did for me... Well, I suppose you have the right to hear the truth of things. The WHOLE truth, rather." 

Oswald clears his throat with a theatrical flair.

"W-wait! Don't just leave me here! How am I supposed to get off this cursed island without a boat?!

"Maybe... I could join your crew?"
"That tenacious little wretch! I owe her my thanks - and a drink. Several drinks. And a fair bit of money, too." He grimaces, his broad brow furrowed with deep wrinkles.
"So, about my reward..."
"Those Steel Garrote zealots have been after me for DECADES. Good riddance!"
"You'll remember that the Dyrwood was once a colony of Aedyr, yes? Well, I was one of the first colonists to set foot on that benighted continent."
"When it became evident the Dyrwood intended to revolt, I took their side in the War of Defiance... against the country of my birth."
"I'm sure you'll be astounded to learn the powers that be in Aedyr didn't much like that. The Steel Garrote's been after me for my 'grave' transgression ever since."
"That was over 150 years ago! They've been hunting you all this time?"
"I'm impressed you've survived this long."
"Those Steel Garrote hounds are RELENTLESS."
"They're why I had to abandon the Goose and Fox Inn shortly after founding it, incidentally."
"You stood up for what you believe in! That's admirable."
"As am I, my friend, as am I." He rubs at the back of his neck and chuckles nervously.
"But it should be a couple of years before they find me again, thanks to you. At least, I hope as much." His shoulders slump.
"Admirable? Perhaps. Foolhardy? Almost certainly. Had I really the right of things, I wouldn't have gone to the Dyrwood in the first place."
"But I appreciate your kind words all the same." He hiccups.
[Wink] "You might say you've dug yourself a little tomb deep."
Oswald groans and puts his head in his hands.

"While he's at it, cap, he's got a gold-plated galleon to sell you."

He rolls his large green eyes.
[Shrug.]
"Whether by providence or chance, I thank the gods you found me when you did."
"You're broke, aren't you."
"Why do I get the feeling I'm not going to like what you're about to say?"
[Glare silently.]
"Ye-e-es. U-unfortunate business mishap. You, uh, know how it is, I'm sure."
"You owe Kahn some money. Fork it over."
"I wasn't looking for you at all."
"Heh, well, you see... I haven't any coin to spare. Flat broke, as it happens!"
"So I came all the way out here for nothing?"
[Leave] "Looks like I need to have words with a certain someone in Neketaka."
A bead of sweat rolls down Oswald's temple. He turns into pudding beneath your steely gaze, shaking and shrinking away.
"W-well, you see... I, ah, have some had some difficult business dealings of late. I'm flat broke, as it were."
He titters nervously and twists the hem of his robe in his hands, unwilling to meet your eye.
He titters nervously and twists the hem of his robe in his hands, unwilling to meet your eye.
He titters nervously and twists the hem of his robe in his hands, unwilling to meet your eye.
"You have a ship, don't you? Of course you do - how else would you have gotten to this benighted island?" He shifts he weight from foot to foot, restless and unsettled.
"Let me join your crew."
"Welcome aboard, Oswald."
"Ugh, I suppose."
[Leave] "No thanks."
"Well, not NOTHING. You did save my life, after all!"
"Thank you, my friend! I owe you a debt twice over." He gives you a toothy grin and stands a hand's breadth taller.
"Oh, fine. Welcome aboard."
[Leave.] "That's not my problem. Farewell."
"Hunting a god doesn't cost much beyond time and sweat. Want to take over for us?"

"Ac. I know what happens to those who don't pay their debts in the Republics."

She narrows her eyes at the man who is growing increasingly agitated with each passing moment.

"Lesson to be learned here... A copper stolen be safer than a copper borrowed."

Furry blue arms crossed, Serafen shakes his head.

"In my tribe, debtors went diving for snails in the Great Reef. Sometimes for days." 

TekÄ“hu raises an eyebrow.
"I know I ought to be feeling charitable... but I mostly just want to wring his neck."
"Aena-who?"

"A friend from the, ah, Wild Mare. In Neketaka? You know. Or maybe you don't? Well, ah, never mind that."

A deep red blush creeps across his wrinkled cheeks.
"What could you offer as a member of my crew?"

"It's no secret I'm an old man. Now, I might not be able to hoist a mainsail any longer, but I've picked up a thing or two about navigation in my decades of traveling!"

He bounces back on his heels, every word coming faster than the last.
"And I don't care much for coin, I can tell you that. An extra ration of rum here and there, and I'll be perfectly contented."
"I should have let those cultists kill you."

"The fercÃ¶nyng was bleeding the colony dry of artifacts and resources. We were right to oppose his rule!"

Though his words are fiery, Oswald flinches away from you, clearly frightened.
"You had a duty to your nation and your forsook it. You're a traitor."
[Glare silently.]

"I wear the name of 'traitor' GLADLY, then! I did what was right, and I have no regrets."

Oswald balls his hands into fists and stands his ground, no longer shrinking from you.
"Yeah, I think we went over all this 'traitor' stuff a while back. Might have my history wrong, but I'm pretty sure we won."
"In-deed. And we sacrificed MUCH to secure that victory!" Oswald's jowls shake with the force of his words.

"I did what was right, and I have no regrets."

Oswald balls his hands into fists and stands his ground, no longer shrinking from you.

"Perhaps I could, ah, make it up to you? You have a ship, yes? Of course you do - how else would you have gotten to this benighted island?" He shifts he weight from foot to foot, restless and unsettled.
He presses a simple length of string twisted into a makeshift ring into your palm and nods, a small frown tugging at the corner of his lips.

"Well, that's not entirely true, is it? I have this old ring. It's the last possession of any value I own.

"Here, take it. For your trouble."
"Gods alive, I can't believe I made it out of there in one piece!"

"I lost my dearest friend, Admeth Hadret, to the war. I feel his absence every day.

"And I would watch him die a THOUSAND times if it meant freedom for the Dyrwood."
"I could find use for a man with your passion. Welcome aboard, Oswald."
"If you'll shut up about the war, you can join my crew."
[Leave] "Justified or not, you're still a traitor, and I'll have nothing to do with you."
"I don't want on your miserable ship anyway!" Oswald yells at your back as you walk away.
"After your INSULT, my pride begs me to refuse." He shakes his heads ruefully and gives you a sheepish grin.
"Alright. What could you offer as a member of my crew?"

"But I am a practical man more even than I am a principled one. I would be glad to take leave of this place on your ship.

"Thank you, my friend. I owe you a debt twice over." He gives you a toothy grin and stands a hand's breadth taller.
